definitions: the action of a country or its government preparing and organizing troops for active service

examples.text: mobilization of the army in 1941 brought 2,500,000 men under arms

shortDefinitions: action of country or its government preparing and organizing troops for active service

definitions: the action of organizing and encouraging a group of people to take collective action in pursuit of a particular objective

examples.text: mobilization of the working class against big business

shortDefinitions: action of organizing and encouraging group of people to take collective action

definitions: the action of bringing resources into use for a particular purpose

examples.text: the mobilization of resources to handle emergencies
large-scale mobilization of capital through stable institutions

shortDefinitions: action of bringing resources into use for particular purpose

definitions: the action of making something movable or capable of movement

examples.text: mobilization of the shoulder can be resumed within 10 days following injury

shortDefinitions: action of making something movable or capable of movement
